text.section:
This section does not apply to:
a lawyer while employed as a part-time master for juvenile cases; or
an individual while:
performing an affirmative duty required by law; or
engaging in an activity related to a case in which the individual is a party or has a property interest.
An individual employed as a sheriff or deputy sheriff in Washington County who has been admitted to the Bar may practice law in a county other than Washington County.

section.section: This subsection does not apply to the settlement of small estates as set forth in Title 5, Subtitle 6 of the Estates and Trusts Article.

In Prince George's County, a sheriff, deputy sheriff, warden, deputy warden, clerk, or employee of any court may not prepare or help in the preparation of any form or document that is filed in a court in that county or that affects a case that is or may be filed in a court in that county.
